block.p: With President Clinton's efforts to bring peace to the Middle East before he leaves office frustrated (front page, Sept. 8), why doesn't he concentrate on finishing the peace process in another part of the world?

With President Clinton's efforts to bring peace to the Middle East before he leaves office frustrated (front page, Sept. 8), why doesn't he concentrate on finishing the peace process in another part of the world?

War-crime suspects like the Bosnian Serbs Radovan Karadzic and Gen. Ratko Mladic -- not to mention Slobodan Milosevic, the Yugoslav leader -- still roam freely throughout their Balkan lands. Mr. Clinton should finish the job he began in the Balkans and have these men arrested and sent to The Hague to stand trial before the end of his term. He will then be remembered not only for bringing a shaky peace to the Balkans but also justice as well.
The writer served as an official of the United Nations Protection Force in the former Yugoslavia, 1994-95.
